intro: Tagetes ostenii, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its flowers are also used in traditional medicine and as a natural pest repellent.
